{"step_by_step_thinking": "Gingival connective tissue is primarily composed of collagen fibers and fibroblasts. The collagen fibers make up the majority of the tissue, while fibroblasts, which produce the collagen, are less in number. According to most sources, collagen fibers make up about 60% of the gingival connective tissue, while fibroblasts make up about 5%.", "answer_choice": "A"}
